meanings.definition: A quick flight past a target.
meanings.sent1: The bird did a flyby of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The spaceship performed a flyby of the planet.
meanings.sent3: The flyby of the squirrel around the yard was quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The flyby of the car on the highway was like a shooting star.
meanings.sent5: The flyby of the paper airplane was swift and graceful.

meanings.definition: A close approach to a celestial body for observation.
meanings.sent1: The telescope captured the flyby of the comet.
meanings.sent2: The satellite conducted a flyby of the moon.
meanings.sent3: The flyby of the alien spaceship was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The flyby of the meteor shower was a celestial dance.
meanings.sent5: The flyby of the shooting star left everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: The flyby of the butterfly in the garden was lovely.
meanings.sent2: The flyby of the hummingbird at the feeder was quick.
meanings.sent3: The flyby of the ice cream truck made everyone excited.
meanings.sent4: The flyby of the delivery truck was like a flash of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The flyby of the neighbor's cat was a brief moment of joy.
